result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor D Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 15-CF-99 & 15-CF-137.  Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 1/12/17 at 3:00 pm.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victim without approval of victim and Dept. of Corrections except for child exchange and needed child related communications.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

ADDRESS INFO for Trevor D Lucas

Prior: 713 N. 4th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, question defendants current employment. Defendant indicates he's working at Apes Bar and Grill, starting tomorrow at Sunnypoint Gardens.  Defendant has made one $25 payment since last hearing, has completed about 10 hours of community service. Agent Siefert confirms one payment, hasn't seen verification of any community service, didn't know about new job until today. Court lifts stay on 30 days of conditional jail time in 15-CF-99, defendant will be taken into custody to serve those 30 days. Huber release is granted.
New discharge date is 5/16/18.
from ADA Korb requesting 5/10/17 PRH be rescheduled because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Probation review hearing on April 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appears late at 11:51 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears at 11:51 am.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions defendant on whether he's working or not. Defendant was let go from Wiretech, currently looking for a job. Defendant has not completed his community service hours, plans to go to Habitat for Humanity to do some community service next week.  Agent Siefert indicates defendant has not been making any payments toward his financial obligations. State concerned that defendant hasn't done anything while on probation. Court sets another probation review hearing. If defendant hasn't completed some of the conditions of his probation by next hearing, court may be lifting the stay on the jail time. Court quashes warrant.  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 10, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  Agent Siefert indicates defendant was aware of todays hearing. He's not working, has no excuse for not being here. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Sara Siefert present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Agent Siefert indicates defendant is currently working at Midwest Wire. State would like to see defendant continue to work, requests another probation review date. Court reschedules matter.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Cts. 2, 3 & 4 reads in for sentencing.   Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates 15-CF-99 is proceeding to trial on Wednesday. 15-CF-103, 15-CF-137 and 16-CF-22 will continue to track 15-CF-99. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Reetz asks court to set matter for waiver of prelim. Atty Reetz feels trial in 15-CF-99 can be taken off the calendar, feels all matters will resolve short of trial. State feels it's premature to remove trial from the calendar. State/Defense request another status/waiver of prelim.  Bond remains in effect.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 3:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/15/16. (fingerprint card destroyed 5/19/16)
No contact direct or indirect with C.T.    To be fingerprinted and photographed within 10 days.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court advises defendant to contact PD office to get Atty Reetz appointed. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
